page.title: 13OAKRIDGE NEAR CHALFORD
page.content: Oakridge is a small residential Cotswold village.There is an old mill and a forge which is open to the public as a sort of museum.The Blacksmith does ornamental ironwork but doesn't shoe horses. Oakridge is not an industrial place.The only shop is the Post Office,which is also a village store. For worship there is the church which holds one service on a Sunday,at 10.30 a.m.The church (St. Bartholomew) has a sundial above the main door. There is a two-hourly bus service to Stroud from outside the school.The railway line runs close by the village but there is no station,although a former chairman of British Rail lived in the village.The Village Hall is situated on the side of the playing field.There is only one public house.
